title: Telangana bets on women to power its $1 trillion economy
content: With new incentives, subsidies and structured support through programmes like Indira Mahila Shakti, RAMP and WE-Hub, the government is building an ecosystem where micro-enterprises can scale and women can build wealth on their own terms, even as small self-help groups formalise businesses, access capital and step into sectors that were once beyond their reach

title: A normal home, a unique idea: Group living initiative in Hyderabad gives special-needs persons a life of choice
content: Five community homes in northern Hyderabad are reshaping what adulthood and independence can mean for people with special needs by offering real routines, real responsibilities and real freedom, supported by caregivers and a campus that builds skills for life and work

title: MCH bogged down by patients, staff inadequacies
content: While hospital officials assert that Venu received appropriate medical attention according to established protocols, the incident highlights systemic issues, such as overcrowding and shortage of staff, at the MCH.

title: Delhi airport chaos: System crash could have been avoided? ATC Guild had issued warning months earlier
content: A recent system crash grounding numerous Indian flights could have been prevented. Air traffic controllers had previously flagged performance issues and urged timely system upgrades to meet global safety standards. Despite repeated warnings to airport authorities, critical safety concerns regarding outdated air navigation systems remain unaddressed, impacting operational efficiency.

title: Connectivity boost: PM Modi flags off four new Vande Bharat trains; check time-table
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has launched four new Vande Bharat Express trains, enhancing rail travel across key Indian routes. These modern, high-speed trains will connect Bengaluru-Ernakulam, Varanasi-Khajuraho, Lucknow Junction-Saharanpur, and Firozpur Cantt-Delhi.

title: ‚ÄòImmigrant could become public charge‚Äô: Getting a US visa may get harder for many ‚Äì who's affected?
content: A new Trump administration directive instructs consular officers to consider applicants' health conditions and ability to afford treatment when determining visa eligibility. This move expands the 'public charge' rule, potentially impacting individuals with chronic illnesses and raising concerns about discrimination and arbitrary decisions.

title: Rising air pollution: Tharoor takes 'Delhi injurious to health' dig; shares old post
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has pointed out Delhi-NCR's ongoing air pollution crisis. He shared a six-year-old social media post that remains relevant today. Since Diwali, the national capital's air quality has been poor to severe. The Air Quality Index is high, with many areas reporting very poor conditions. Shallow fog is also expected, reducing visibility.

title: Jasprit Bumrah set to create history no Indian has achieved before - big record on the line
content: Overall, in 79 T20Is,  Jasprit Bumrah has picked up 99 wickets in 77 innings at an average of 18.11, with best figures of 3/7 and an economy rate of 6.36. He is currently India‚Äôs second-highest wicket-taker in the format, behind Arshdeep Singh, who has 105 wickets in 67 matches.

title: ‚ÄòGaza genocide‚Äô page: Wikipedia co-founder ‚Äòagrees‚Äô with Musk; Tesla CEO called site 'biased'
content: Wikipedia co-founder Jimmy Wales has intervened in an editorial dispute over the platform's "Gaza genocide" article, citing a violation of neutrality. He stated the article's lead paragraph presents a contested claim as fact, failing to meet Wikipedia's standards. This intervention aligns with Elon Musk's prior accusations of a left-wing bias on the platform.

title: Why Zarine Khan‚Äôs funeral followed Hindu rituals ‚Äî son Zayed fulfilled her last wish
content: Zarine Khan, wife of actor Sanjay Khan, passed away at 81. Her funeral was conducted according to Hindu rituals, as she was born Hindu and never converted to Islam. Her son Zayed Khan led the 'dah-sanskar', fulfilling her last wish.

title: ‚ÄòNo one visited this Diwali‚Äô: Family of Muskan Rastogi puts house on sale; plans to leave Meerut
content: Facing social boycott and painful memories after their daughter's alleged involvement in a sensational murder case, the Rastogi family has put their Meerut residence up for sale. The family's jewellery business has collapsed, and they are ostracized by the community, leading to their decision to leave the city.

title: Spot on! Ex-IND coach turns astrologer; wild World Cup prediction comes true
content: Former India fielding coach Biju George boldly predicted India's Women's World Cup victory, a prophecy that came true as they defeated Australia in the semis and South Africa in the final. He attributed the win to the team's evolving dynamics, improved finishing, and exceptional fielding, highlighting Harmanpreet Kaur's growth and the impact of players like Jemimah Rodrigues.

title: Ford CEO questions Apple‚Äôs CarPlay: Warns of overreach; questions Tim Cook
content: Ford CEO Jim Farley expressed strong concerns about Apple's CarPlay Ultra, fearing it encroaches too deeply into vehicle control. He questioned how far Apple's brand should extend into car functions, emphasizing the digital experience as a key differentiator for future vehicles. This follows similar reservations from other automakers and GM's decision to drop both CarPlay and Android Auto.

title: US grants Hungary one-year exemption from Russian oil sanctions; here's why
content: The United States has granted Hungary a one-year exemption from its sanctions on Russian oil and gas following a personal appeal from Prime Minister Viktor Orb√°n to President Donald Trump. Trump cited Hungary's landlocked status and lack of ports as reasons for the exemption, while Orb√°n warned of severe economic consequences.

title: China makes it clear: We do not want Nvidia, Intel, AMD; and Trump cannot help
content: China is mandating state-funded data centers to exclusively use domestic AI chips, instructing projects under construction to remove foreign components. This significant move aims to achieve AI chip self-sufficiency, impacting major foreign suppliers like Nvidia, AMD, and Intel. The directive underscores Beijing's accelerating push to reduce reliance on American technology amidst ongoing trade tensions.

title: What happened to Alex Vesia‚Äôs baby? Dodgers pitcher opens up online
content: Los Angeles Dodgers pitcher Alex Vesia and his wife Kayla announced the tragic death of their newborn daughter, Sterling Sol Vesia, on November 7, 2025. The couple shared an emotional Instagram post revealing their daughter passed away on October 26, 2025. Vesia expressed deep gratitude to the Dodgers, fans, and medical staff for their support during this difficult time.

title: Cash prizes, govt jobs: India's World Cup heroines showered with rewards
content: India's ICC Women's World Cup 2025 victory has ignited nationwide celebrations.  Players are receiving grand welcomes and substantial rewards from their home states.  From Maharashtra's Rs 2.25 crore for Mandhana and Rodrigues to Andhra Pradesh's Rs 2.5 crore for Shree Charani, these honours highlight the immense pride and inspiration the team has brought to every corner of the nation.

title: Al-Qaeda, ISIS-linked unrest in Mali: Five Indian workers kidnapped near Kobri
content: Five Indian nationals working on electrification projects in Mali have been kidnapped near Kobri by gunmen. The company has evacuated remaining Indian employees to Bamako as a precaution. This incident highlights Mali's ongoing struggle with rising insecurity and violence from jihadist groups, with no group yet claiming responsibility for the abduction.

title: This 15-minute Japanese ritual can reduce the risk of stroke and boost heart health
content: Discover a simple Japanese habit that relaxes your mind and boosts circulation. Soaking feet in warm water for 15-20 minutes improves blood flow and reduces stress. This practice also aids sleep and eases muscle tension. It is especially beneficial for older adults, those with anxiety, and individuals facing sleep issues.

title: ‚ÄòSomething special‚Äô: Trump endorses Vivek in Ohio governor race; calls him ‚Äòyoung, strong, smart‚Äô
content: Donald Trump has thrown his significant weight behind Indian-origin entrepreneur Vivek Ramaswamy for the 2026 Ohio governor race, issuing a strong endorsement. Trump lauded Ramaswamy as a "SPECIAL" candidate, highlighting his youth, strength, and love for the country. This backing comes as Republicans aim to unite behind Ramaswamy, a conservative outsider, in a state Trump has won decisively.

title: 'Aaj sher ghaas khaa raha tha': Suryakumar Yadav takes a dig at Abhishek Sharma - Watch
content: India secured victory in the 4th T20I against Australia in a low-scoring match in Queensland, where several players, including Abhishek Sharma and captain Suryakumar Yadav, faced batting challenges on a difficult pitch. India posted 167/8, which proved sufficient as Australia was bowled out for 119 in 18.2 overs. Abhishek, who had been dominant against the Australian bowlers throughout the series, managed only 28 runs from 21 balls, batting well below his usual strike rate of over 200.

title: 116-year-old world‚Äôs oldest living woman's secret to long life is not exercise but...
content: At 116 years old, Ethel Caterham is officially the oldest person alive.  She credits her incredible lifespan not to strict diets or intense workouts, but to a calm mind.  Her key to living so long?  She avoids arguments and always sticks to her own decisions, living life on her own terms.

title: Former Magic coach and analyst Richie Adubato dies at 87 after illness
content: Basketball mourns the loss of Richie Adubato, 87, a beloved coach and broadcaster whose six-decade career touched the NBA, WNBA, and radio waves. Known for his wit and passion, Adubato left an indelible mark on the sport, from coaching the Orlando Magic to mentoring players and entertaining fans. His genuine spirit and humor will be deeply missed.

title: 'Mother-baby doing fine': Hospital shares update; Katrina-Vicky welcomes baby boy
content: Katrina Kaif and Vicky Kaushal welcomed their baby boy on November 7, 2025. The hospital confirmed both mother and child are doing well and stable. The couple's announcement was met with a flood of congratulatory messages from fans and industry colleagues.

title: Marshawn Kneeland death: Darius Slay‚Äôs wife Jennifer shares emotional plea
content: Dallas Cowboys defensive end Marshawn Kneeland, 24, died by self-inflicted gunshot wound days after scoring his first NFL touchdown. His death followed a brief police pursuit. The tragedy has prompted widespread grief and calls for greater mental health awareness in the NFL, with many teammates and public figures sharing their sorrow and support.

title: Sidney Crosby future: GM Kyle Dubas makes firm call on Penguins captain
content: Pittsburgh Penguins GM Kyle Dubas has definitively stated that captain Sidney Crosby's future remains with the team. Dubas emphasized his commitment to building a contending roster around Crosby, with no plans to trade the veteran.  He believes continued success and winning are the best solutions for the team's long-term vision.

title: Gisele B√ºndchen says prioritizing Tom Brady took a toll: ‚ÄúLove isn‚Äôt a jail
content: Supermodel Gisele B√ºndchen, in a candid interview, shared insights into her marriage with Tom Brady, describing their split as a 'death and rebirth.' She detailed her journey of shifting from supporting her partner's career to rediscovering her own dreams and defining personal success. B√ºndchen emphasizes her graciousness towards Brady, highlighting her focus on authenticity and fulfillment in her new chapter.

title: 'No US government official will attend‚Äô: Trump to boycott G20 in South Africa
content: US President Donald Trump declared no American officials would attend the upcoming G20 summit in South Africa, citing alleged mistreatment of white farmers and calling it a "total disgrace." Trump accused the South African government of human rights abuses and illegal land confiscation. He plans to host the 2026 G20 in Miami, Florida.

title: Asia Cup trophy row: 'Informal discussions' on sidelines of ICC meet in Dubai
content: It is learnt that there were some informal discussions on the sidelines of the ICC Board meet where BCCI secretary Devajit Saikia pointed out that India, the winners of 2025 Asia Cup, are yet to get the trophy. While Saikia was representing the Indian cricket board, Mohsin Naqvi represented the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB).

title: November 8, 2025: Best time today, as per your zodiac sign
content: November 8th marks Ganadhipa Sankashti Chaturthi, an auspicious day for worshipping Lord Ganesha to remove obstacles and bring prosperity. Astrologer Vishal Bhardwaj outlines specific Shubh Muhurats for each zodiac sign, offering guidance for various activities from business decisions to personal well-being.

title: Hrithik Roshan comforts ex-wife Sussanne as she mourns mother Zarine Khan
content: Zarine Khan, mother of Sussanne and Zayed Khan, has passed away at 81. Bollywood celebrities gathered at Sanjay Khan's Mumbai residence to pay their respects. Hrithik Roshan was seen supporting his ex-wife Sussanne during the emotional time. Many stars attended the funeral, offering condolences to the family. Hrithik and Sussanne's continued warm bond remains a talking point.

title: Donald Trump to reenter NFL Spotlight at Lions vs Commanders Game
content: Former President Donald Trump's attendance at the Lions vs. Commanders game injects significant political weight into the NFL's Salute to Service weekend. His presence, especially during a government shutdown affecting military participation, amplifies the game's narrative. Trump, who has previously criticized the league, will be a focal point, reminding everyone how sports and politics intertwine, even in a stadium setting.

title: Cricket at LA Olympics 2028: How teams will be picked; why no guarantee of India vs Pak
content: There could be a strong possibility of not seeing an India vs Pakistan contest at Los Angeles Olympics, as the details of the global qualifier are still unknown. In the detailed statement after the ICC Board meeting, the sport's global body mentioned the success of women's cricket and also shared an update on the LA28 Games.

title: Klay Thompson apologizes to Megan Thee Stallion after airport pickup mishap
content: Dallas Mavericks star Klay Thompson went viral for his heartfelt apology and remorse after arriving late to pick up girlfriend Megan Thee Stallion from the airport. He presented her with flowers, expressing genuine regret, which fans found "adorably human." The couple's authentic connection continues to charm audiences as they both thrive in their careers.

title: Michael Porter Jr & Sophie Cunningham spark dating rumors after viral post
content: Recent viral rumors falsely linked NBA star Michael Porter Jr. and WNBA player Sophie Cunningham romantically. The speculation stemmed from a parody account, despite the two being lifelong friends from the same hometown. Porter Jr. has previously faced criticism for his comments on women's basketball, and his mention of Cunningham appears to be an attempt to mend fences.

title: "Is There A Gold Rush In Bihar?" A Owaisi To NDTV On Infiltration Charge
content: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has snubbed the BJP's charge that the Opposition uses infiltrators as a vote bank,accusing the NDA combine in Bihar of defaming the Muslims after ignoring their progress.

title: "Will Provide Greater Comfort": PM Modi Launches 4 New Vande Bharat Trains
content: PM Modi inaugurated the new Vande Bharat trains on the Banaras-Khajuraho, Lucknow-Saharanpur, Firozpur-Delhi, and Ernakulam-Bengaluru routes.

title: Woman Throws Chilli Powder At Jeweller In Robbery Bid, Gets Slapped 20 Times
content: A woman who entered a jewellery shop in Gujarat's Ahmedabad with the intention of robbing it ended up being slapped nearly 20 times in 25 seconds by the shopkeeper after her plan went awry.

title: "Opposition Needs Self-Introspection": Asaduddin Owaisi To NDTV On Bihar Polls
content: Speaking to NDTV two days after Bihar went to polls in the first phase of assembly elections, Asaduddin Owaisi rejected the Opposition's claim that the AIMIM is a "vote cutter" party.

title: US Launches 175 Probes Into 'Potential Abuse' Of H-1B Visa Program: Report
content: The United States Department of Labor (DOL) recently revealed that it launched at least 175 investigations targeting a potential abuse of the H-1B Visa Program, according to a report by Fox News on Friday.

title: Trump Backs "Young, Strong, Smart" Vivek Ramaswamy For Ohio Governor Race
content: Vivek Ramaswamy is "something special", US President Donald Trump has said in a social media post, throwing his weight behind the Indian-origin billionaire Republican for the 2026 Ohio Governor race.

title: 1 Dead, Child Injured In Massive Slum Fire In Delhi
content: One person died after a massive fire broke out in a slum area near Rithala Metro Station in the national capital on Friday night, officials said.

title: 2 Terrorists Killed In Encounter In J&K's Kupwara
content: Two terrorists were killed by security forces in an ongoing encounter in Jammu and Kashmir's Kupwara district, officials said on Saturday.

title: Indira Gandhi Didn't Approve Strike On Pakistan Nuclear Facility: Ex-CIA Officer
content: Former CIA officer Richard Barlow revealed that the proposed joint covert operation by India and Israel to bomb Pakistan's Kahuta nuclear facility in the early 1980s to halt Islamabad's atomic ambition could have "solved a lot of problems."

title: US Knew Pakistan Could Deploy Nuclear Weapons On F-16s: Ex-CIA Officer
content: Former CIA officer Richard Barlow said successive US Presidents continued to certify that Pakistan did not possess nuclear weapons all the way through 1989 and despite knowing that Islamabad could deploy nuclear weapons on F-16s, the US supplied them

title: Trinamool MP Loses Rs 55 Lakh In Cyber Fraud, Amount Transferred Twice
content: Four-time Trinamool Congress Lok Sabha member, Kalyan Banerjee, reportedly lost Rs 55 lakh in an online financial fraud in West Bengal.

title: Flight Ops At Delhi Airport "Gradually Improving" Nearly 36 Hours Post Tech Glitch
content: Officials said that 129 flights (53 arrivals and 76 departures) have been delayed on Saturday - as compared to the nearly 800 delays witnessed on Friday.

title: US Judge Declares Mistrial In MIT Grad Brothers' $25 Million Crypto Fraud Case
content: James Peraire-Bueno, 29, and his brother Anton, 25, argued their actions were fair game in an unregulated market.

title: US Removes Syria's Al-Sharaa From Terror List Ahead Of His Washington Visit
content: The United States on Friday formally removed Syrian President Ahmed al-Sharaa from a terrorism blacklist, days before the former jihadist is set to make a landmark visit to Washington.

title: Nigerian Man Staying In India Illegally For Over 10 Years Deported
content: 43-year-old Johnkennedy Chukwuemeka Okoro, a resident of Imo State, Nigeria, had initially arrived in Mumbai in 2012 on a business visa.

title: Sabarimala Gold Heist Case: Ex-Thiruvabharanam Commissioner Sent To Custody
content: The Special Investigation Team (SIT) probing the Sabarimala gold heist has secured the remand of the former Thiruvabharanam Commissioner till November 21 in connection with the case on Friday.

title: Tej Pratap's Airport Meet With BJP's Ravi Kishan Sparks Speculations
content: Janshakti Janata Dal founder Tej Pratap Yadav and BJP MP Ravi Kishan were seen together at the Patna airport on Friday, raising eyebrows amid the assembly elections.

title: "Big Lie": Iran Junks US' Claim That Tehran Trying To Kill Israeli Envoy
content: The United States and Israel on Friday accused Iran of trying to kill the Israeli ambassador to Mexico, with Tehran rejecting the claim as a "big lie" and the Mexican government saying it was not aware.

title: Samir Modi Seeks Quashing Of Rape FIR In Delhi Court, Hearing On January 12
content: The Delhi High Court has issued a notice on the plea of Samir Modi for quashing of FIR in an alleged rape case. An FIR was registered at Police Station New Friends Colony. He was granted bail by the Saket District Court on September 25.

content: The TOI Science Desk stands as an inquisitive team of journalists, ceaselessly delving into the realms of discovery to curate a captivating collection of news, features, and articles from the vast and ever-evolving world of science for the readers of The Times of India.
